subtasks: Approach the chicken coop.
Open the entrance door of the chicken coop.
Reach into the coop and gather a feeding scoop.
Scoop feed from the storage container into the feeding scoop.
Walk to the designated feeding area.
Distribute the feed evenly across the feeding area.
Close the entrance door after finishing.
Approach the chicken coop.
Open the entrance door of the chicken coop.
Observe the chickens for any signs of illness or injury.
Check each chicken's plumage, behavior, and droppings.
Take note of any chickens that require additional attention.
Approach the chicken coop.
Open the entrance door of the chicken coop.
Walk to the nesting boxes.
Carefully lift each egg from the nesting box without dropping it.
Place the eggs into a collection basket or tray.
Close the entrance door after finishing.
Approach the chicken coop.
Open the entrance door of the chicken coop.
Remove any uneaten feed, droppings, or spilled food from the floor.
Wipe down nesting boxes with a hose or cleaning solution.
Ventilate the coop by opening windows or doors.
Close the entrance door after cleaning.
Approach the chicken coop.
Open the entrance door of the chicken coop.
Check the waterers for proper functioning and adequate water levels.
Fill waterers if necessary.

tasks.task: Locate and return a lost chicken.
subtasks: Identify the missing chicken by its distinct markings or behavior.
Walk around the property, calling the chicken's name.
Check hidden areas such as sheds, bushes, or under buildings.
Find the lost chicken and lead it back to the coop.
Check the coop's ventilation system for proper functioning.
Monitor the coop's temperature and humidity levels.
Adjust ventilation or temperature control as needed.
Inspect the coop's structural integrity for any damages.
Clean or repair any damaged areas.

tasks.task: Observe and maintain the garden surrounding the coop.
subtasks: Walk around the chicken coop to survey the garden area.
Check for any weeds or invasive plants.
Remove any debris or fallen leaves from the garden.
Water the plants if necessary.
Prune or trim any overgrown vegetation.

tasks.task: Collect eggs from the coop at night.
subtasks: As in MAINTASK: Collect eggs from the coop, but at nighttime.

tasks.task: Ensure the security of the chicken coop.
subtasks: Walk around the perimeter of the coop to check for potential entry points.
Close any gaps or holes with wire mesh or hardware cloth.
Check locks or latches on the entrance door.
Ensure all windows are securely closed.
Determine the appropriate feed supplement based on the chickens' diet requirements.
Measure the required amount of supplement.
Mix the supplement into the feed or provide it separately.
Monitor the chickens' response to the supplement.
Identified that the existing brooder lamp needs changing.
Take off the current brooder lamp.
Replace it with a new lamp of the correct wattage.
Check the temperature inside the brooder area.

tasks.task: Collect eggs during peak laying season.
subtasks: As in MAINTASK: Collect eggs from the coop, but during peak laying season when more eggs are laid.

tasks.task: Inspect the chickens for mites or lice.
subtasks: Examine the chickens closely for signs of external parasites.
Use a magnifying glass or comb to check the feathers and skin.
Remove detected parasites if found.
Apply appropriate treatments if necessary.

tasks.task: Maintain air quality in the coop.
subtasks: Open windows or doors for cross ventilation.
Use fans or ventilation systems to regulate air movement.
Ensure adequate carbon dioxide levels do not build up.
Monitor for ammonia odors indicating urine buildup.
Adjust bedding if necessary to reduce ammonia.

tasks.task: Ensure proper ventilation in the coop.
subtasks: Open windows or vents to allow fresh air circulation.
Check for any blockages in air intake or exhaust.
Adjust the placement of air vents for optimal airflow.
Check the incubator for proper temperature and humidity settings.
Monitor the progress of hatching eggs.
Help turn eggs as needed.
Prepare the brooder area for new chicks.
Identify sick chickens with clinical signs.
Obtain the appropriate medication from storage.
Administer the medication according to the veterinarian's instructions.
Monitor the chickens for improved health.

tasks.task: Check the timing of the feed distribution.
subtasks: Observe the chickens' feeding habits to ensure consistent distribution.
Adjust the feeding schedule if necessary.
